item.title: Rip Hugo
item.dc:creator: Grach
item.description:
JeffMOD:

And two minutes before your post, if you check the timestamps.

This is true, but as you said, almost every single government in the world is rife with corruption. And I don’t see anyone talking shit about their leaders at the moment.
Basically, it’s because he’s dead. He died, and he was a socialist, so people feel the need to say shit like “I’m glad he’s dead” and “about fucking time” like he was Adolf Stalin-Bin-Laden. He wasn’t a bad person, he made some bad decisions, people under him did as well. Just because someone’s not a capitalist doesn’t automatically make them the Enemy Of Freedom™

I’m just sick and tired of people doing shit like this all the time over petty differences like political views. If you uncover evidence that he murdered babies and raped women every day, then I’ll agree with the sentiments. But until you can prove they were, in fact, an immoral person, please don’t say it’s a good thing somebody died.

Just a bit of food for thought; If the president of, say, France died, there would be a lot less people on the burning effigies bandwagon, simply because of the politics. And the ones that were on it would ALL be from France and neighboring countries they deal with regularly.

I hate him because he blatantly rigged elections and had the oposition shut down. I don’t care if you’re corrupt, but undermining free-speech is crossing the line for me. Also he was so populist that he felt he needed to donate money to other countries and praise even the smallest thing that agreed with him. Even if it didn’t have to do anything with him.

By the way, our president is a short-armed incopetent jinx that for some reason rules the country. Seriously, not even Pinochet had an approval rating so low.

Read full topic

I’m just sick and tired of people doing shit like this all the time over petty differences like political views. Just a bit of food for thought; If the president of, say, France died, there would be a lot less people on the burning effigies bandwagon, simply because of the politics. And the ones that were on it would ALL be from France and neighboring countries they deal with regularly.

item.title: Rip Hugo
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
JeffMOD:

Oh yeah, another one of those damn communist dictators.
You know, those assholes that give free healthcare and education to their citizens, and holds elections and referendums.

Socialism is not the same as communism. And neither requires the person in charge to remain that way through force. Okay, yes, there was a revolution. Then some elections, after which a new constitution was drafted and more rights and freedoms were given.
Kind of like America had a few centuries back.

Also, during his presidency Venezuela’s poverty rate was cut by over half, and they kept gas prices down to about 11 cents/litre for his citizens. Right now, any gas station in my area charges about $1.23/litre.

Please, do some research before slinging mud.

His government also expropriated a lot of privately-owned properties. And I’m not only talking about big multinational companies, I’m talking about regular people’s houses that the government thought would be better if used for the greater goodm while leaving these people with no compensation at all.

Also, the elections they held are some of the least transparent ones in recent memory in South America.

Please, do some research before painting the world in black and white. There’s corruption all over the world, and doing good stuff doesn’t undo the bad. And viceversa.

EDIT: Sneaky edit is sneaky.

Read full topic

item.title: Rip Hugo
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Oh yeah, another one of those damn communist dictators.
You know, those assholes that give free healthcare and education to their citizens, and holds elections and referendums.

Socialism is not the same as communism. And neither requires the person in charge to remain that way through force. Okay, yes, there was a revolution. Then some elections, after which a new constitution was drafted and more rights and freedoms were given.
Kind of like America had a few centuries back.

Also, during his presidency Venezuela’s poverty rate was cut by over half, and they kept gas prices down to about 11 cents/litre for his citizens. Right now, any gas station in my area charges about $1.23/litre.

Please, do some research before slinging mud.
I don’t mean to say he was perfect. Nobody is. But still, some of those posts are really ignorant.

item.title: Rip Hugo

Pyro:

Who the hell…

Oh, Huge Chavez? Was he evil? I never really paid that much attention to Cuba.

*Venezuela, Castro is the Cuban dictator. He did some censorship crap, as already mentioned. Good that Chavez is gone, but whenever one roach dies, five more spring up. Best hope the successor isn’t as bad as he was, but if he’s “good” enough to be called Chavez’s successor, than you may be in some deep shit. Best wishes.
